The Mi Mix 4 also boasts a Qualcomm Snapdragon 888+ processor, 4500mAh battery with 120W charging speed and triple camera on the back with 108MP main shooter.

name: Xiaomi Redmi Note 8 2021
description: Xiaomi Redmi Note 8 2021 comes with 6.3” display, MediaTek Helio G85, 4GB RAM combined with 64GB or 128GB internal storage, 4000 mAh battery with 18W charge speed. Specifications also include Quad camera setup with 48MP main camera on the back, 13 MP selfie camera and Android 11.

name: Xiaomi POCO M3 Pro 5G
description: Xiaomi Poco M3 Pro 5G specs include a 6.5-inch FHD+ display, MediaTek Dimensity 700 processor, 5000mAh battery, and a triple-camera setup. The phone comes in two variants with 4GB Ram and 64GB internal storage and 6GB Ram with 128GB internal storage.

name: Xiaomi Black Shark 4
description: Xiaomi Black Shark 4 is powerful gaming phone that comes with magnetic pop-up triggers and has liquid cooling system. Specifications also include Qualcomm Snapdragon 870 processor, 144Hz display and superfast 120W charging speed. The prices for the 8GB/128 model are 499$ and 599$ for the 12/256GB model.

name: Xiaomi Mi 11 Ultra
description: The most obvious design feature of the Xiaomi Mi 11 Ultra is the humongous camera bump on the back of the phone. Placed next to the triple camera system (more on this later) there’s a 1.1-inch 126 x 294 color AMOLED display. It has an always-on feature, it can display notifications, and it also acts like a mirror when you take a selfie using the main camera system. It’s a really interesting solution and we’re itching to try it out in a real-life scenario. The tiny display is also quite bright with a peak brightness of 450 nits. Speaking of displays, the Mi 11 Ultra comes equipped with a top-of-the-line 120Hz 6.81-inch main AMOLED panel. It’s a curved display with a resolution of 3200 x 1440 pixels and a 20:9 aspect ratio. Xiaomi cites 900 nits typical brightness and up to 1,700 nits peak brightness, and there’s also HDR10+ and Dolby Vision baked into the panel. Fast refresh-rate displays are now becoming a standard, and the Mi 11 Ultra delivers on this front as well. It features a 120Hz refresh rate display and thanks to the AdaptiveSync technology, the panel can switch between 30/60/90 and 120Hz depending on the situation. This is accompanied by a 480Hz touch sampling rate - one of the highest in any smartphone to date.

name: Xiaomi Mi 11i
description: Xiaomi Mi 11 is a Android smartphone with its main features being a triple camera with a 108MP main one, 8MP ultra wide angle secondary camera and a 5MP sensor optimized to capture both macro and tele shots. The phone has a 6.67" AMOLED display capable of working at 120Hz. All this hardware is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 888 chipset.

name: Xiaomi Mi 11 Lite
description: Xiaomi Mi 11 Lite is a mid range Android smartphone with a 6.55” AMOLED 10-bit display capable of 90Hz refresh rate. The handset uses the Qualcomm Snapdragon 780G chipset in the 5G version and the Snapdragon 732G in the 4G only variant. Other features include a 64MP main camera, 33W fast charging capability and a fingerprint scanner.

name: Huawei Mate 40E 4G
description: The Huawei Mate 40E 4G comes with 6.5-inch OLED display with 90Hz refresh rate and Kirin 990E processor. Specs also include 4200mAh battery with 40W charging speed and Triple camera setup on the back with 64MP main sensor.

name: Huawei nova 9 Pro
description: The Huawei nova 9 Pro comes with6.72-inch OLED display with 120Hz refresh rate and Qualcomm Snapdragon 778G 4G processor. Specs also include 4000mAh battery with 100W charging speed and Quad camera setup on the back with 64MP main sensor.

name: Huawei Enjoy 20e
description: The Huawei Enjoy 20e comes with 6.3 inch display and Kirin or MediaTek processor. The battery is 5000mAh and their is Dual camera pn the back with 13MP main sensor.

name: Huawei nova 8 SE 4G
description: The Huawei nova 8 SE 4G comes with 6.5-inch OLED display and Kirin 710A processor. Specs also include 3800mAh battery with 66W charging speed and Quad camera on the back with 64MP main sensor.

name: Huawei P50E
description: The Huawei P50E comes with 6.5-inch OLED display with 90Hz refresh rate and Qualcomm Snapdragon 778G 4G processor. Specs also include 4100mAh battery with 66W charging speed and and Triple camera setup on the back with 50MP main sensor.

name: Huawei nova 10
description: The Huawei nova 10 comes with 6.67-inch OLED display with 120Hz refresh rate and Qualcomm Snapdragon 778G 4G processor. Specs also include 4000mAh battery with 66W charging speed and Triple camera setup on the back with 50MP main sensor.

name: Huawei Mate 50 RS Porsche Design
description: The Huawei Mate 50 RS Porsche Design comes with 6.74-inch OLED display with 120Hz refresh rate and Qualcomm Snapdragon 8+ Gen 1 processor. Specs also include 4700mAh battery with 66W charging speed and Triple camera setup on the back with 50MP main sensor.

name: Huawei Mate 50E
description: The Huawei Mate 50E comes with 6.7-inch OLED display with 90Hz refresh rate and Qualcomm Snapdragon 778G 4G processor. Specs also include 4460mAh battery with 66W charging speed and Dual camera setup on the back with 50MP main sensor.

name: Huawei Mate 50
description: The Huawei Mate 50 comes with 6.7-inch OLED display with 90Hz refresh rate an Qualcomm Snapdragon 8+ Gen 1 processor. Specs also include 4460mAh battery with 66W charging speed and Triple camera setup on the back with 50MP main sensor.

name: Huawei Pocket S
description: The Huawei Pocket S comes with 6.9-inch Foldable OLED display with 120Hz refresh rate and Qualcomm Snapdragon 778G 4G processor.

name: Huawei Mate 50 Pro
description: The Huawei Mate 50 Pro comes with 6.74-inch OLED display with 120Hz refresh rate and Qualcomm Snapdragon 8+ Gen 1 processor. Specs also include 4700mAh battery with 66Wcharging speed ad Triple camera setup on the back with 50MP main sensor.

name: Huawei Nova 10 Pro
description: The Huawei Nova 10 Pro comes with 6.78-inch OLED display with 120Hz refresh rate and Qualcomm Snapdragon 778G processor. Specs also include 4500mAh battery with 100W charging speed and Triple camera setup on the back with 50MP main sensor and Dual Selfie camera on the front.

name: Huawei Mate Xs 2
description: The Huawei Mate Xs 2 comes with outside folding 7.8-inch OLED display and Qualcomm Snapdragon 888 4G processor. Specs also include 4600mAh battery with 66W charging speed, Triple camera setup on the back with 50MP main sensor and 10.7 front selfie camera.

name: Huawei P50 Pocket
description: The Huawei P50 Pocket is the first foldable phone from Huawei with clamshell design. It comes with 6.9-inch OLED display with 120Hz refresh rate and on the back there is 1.04-inch circular OLED display. Specs also include Qualcomm Snapdragon 888 processor, 4000Mah battery with 40W charging speed and triple camera setup on the back with 40MP main camera sensor.

name: Huawei Nova 9
description: The Huawei Nova 9 comes with 6.57-inch OLED display with 120Hz refresh rate and Qualcomm Snapdragon 778G processor. The phone is 4G only and it comes with MIUI 12 without Google services. Specs also include 4300mAh battery with 66W charging speed, Quad setup camera on the back with 50MP main sensor and 32 front selfie camera. Prices start from €499.

name: Huawei P50 Pro
description: The Huawei P50 Pro uses the new operating system from Huawei - HarmonyOS. Specifications include 6.6-inch OLED display with 120Hz refresh rate, Qualcomm Snapdragon 888 4G processor, 4360mAh battery with 66Wcharging speed and 50W wireless charging speed, Quad camera setup on the back with 50MP main sensor and 13MP selfie camera.

name: Huawei P50
description: The Huawei P50 comes with Huawei's own operating system - HarmonyOS 2.0. Specs include big 6.5-inch OLED display with 90Hz refresh rate, 4100mAh battery with 66W charging speed and quad camera setup on the back with 50MP main sensor combined with 13MP selfie camera.

name: Huawei Mate X2
description:
The Mate X2 keeps the large screen promise intact, as it sports an 8-incher when opened yet when closed it has a much bigger external display than the Z Fold 2 - a whopping 6.45" panel with 90Hz refresh rate.
Coming with Huawei's newest Kirin 9000 5G chipset, the Mate X2 foldable phone is not lacking power for complex tasks like gaming or multirframe photography, or memory with 8GB RAM and 256GB/512GB storage options. The camera, too, seems directly lifted from the excellent one on the P40 Pro, what with the huge 50MP sensor, 16MP ultrawide, and two zoom cams - one 12MP 3x telephoto for closer objects or portraits, and one 8MP with the whopping 10x periscope zoom.
The big 4500mAh battery has been carried over from the Xs, as well as the 55W charging. Other notable Mate X2 features include a high 90Hz refresh rate for both displays, magnetically-controlled nano optical layer to minimise reflection, split screen software features for multitasking, and Director's View video streaming on one screen.

name: Huawei Mate 40 Pro
description: Huawei Mate 40 Pro specs include a 6.8-inch OLED display with a 90HZ refresh rate, Kirin 9000 processor, 8GB RAM with 256GB storage combo, and 4400mAh battery. There is a triple-camera setup on the back with a 50MP main sensor, while the selfie shooter is 13MP. The phone is 5G ready and supports 65W fast charging, as well as 50W wireless charging. Android 10 is onboard without Google services and apps. The Mate 40 Pro will be available in Europe starting November, 13 for the price of €1200.

name: Huawei P Smart (2021)
description: Huawei P Smart (2021) specs include a 6.7-inch FHD+ display,  Kirin 710A processor with 4GB RAM and 128GB storage, and 5000mAh battery. There is a quad-camera setup on the back with a 48MP main sensor, while the selfie shooter at the front is 8MP. The Huawei P Smart (2021) comes with Android 10 without Google Play Services. The price across Europe is 229 Euros.

name: Huawei P smart S
description: Huawei P Smart S runs EMUI 10.1 which is based on Android 10. It has a 6.3" OLED display, triple camera setup with the main one being 48MP's. Running the show is the Kirin 710F chipset with the power being supplied by a 4000mAh battery.

name: Huawei P40 lite 5G
description: Huawei P40 lite 5G sports a versatile 64MP AI quad-camera, Kirin 820 chipset accompanied with 6GB RAM/ 128GB storage, and 4000mAh battery. A punch FullView display measuring 6.5 inches is adorning the front. The P40 lite 5G is available in Europe for 400 euros.

name: Huawei P30 Pro New Edition
description: The refreshed P30 Pro New Edition model offers Google apps and services pre-installed. There is 256GB of storage as standard, up from 128GB on the original P30 Pro, and 8GB of RAM. On the software side, buyers get the EMUI 10.1 overlay backed up by Android 10. Other specifications stay unchanged - 6.5-inch OLED display, Kirin 980 processor, quad-camera on the back, and 4200mAh battery. The Huawei P30 Pro New Edition is available across Europe.

name: Huawei P Smart (2020)
description: Huawei P Smart 2020 is an entry-level smartphone with old hardware but at least Google apps and services are included. Under the hood is Kirin 710 chipset with 4GB RAM and 128 gigs of storage, and 3400mAh battery.  There is a dual-camera setup on the back, while an 8MP selfie camera adorns the drop-shaped notch. At the front is also situated a 6.21-inch display with 2340 x 1080 pixel resolution.

name: Huawei P40 Pro+
description: The Huawei P40 Pro+ is available for EUR 1399. For the price, you get 10X periscope optical zoom lens, 5G support, and 40-watt fast charging (both wired and wireless). Under the hood, the phone is powered by Huawei's own Kirin 990 chip, 4200mAh battery and Android 10 (without Google’s apps and services). At the front is situated a 6.58-inch OLED display with a 90HZ refresh rate, an in-screen fingerprint sensor, and a dual selfie camera. The back is adorned by a penta-camera setup with an all-new 50-megapixel RYYB main sensor.

name: Huawei P40 Pro
description: Despite lacking Google’s apps and services out of the box the Huawei P40 Pro features all kinds of flagship goodies like 5X periscope optical zoom lens, 5G support, and 40-watt fast charging (both wired and wireless). Under the hood, the phone is powered by Huawei's own Kirin 990 chip and a battery cell as big as 4200mAh. At the front is situated a 6.58-inch OLED display with a 90HZ refresh rate, an in-screen fingerprint sensor, and a dual selfie camera. The back is adorned by a quad-camera setup with an all-new 50-megapixel RYYB main sensor. The Huawei P40 Pro is available across Europe with a starting price of 999 euros.

name: Huawei P40
description: Huawei P40 is powered by Huawei's own Kirin 990 chip and a 3800mAh battery. At the front is presented a 6.1-inch OLED display with a 90HZ refresh rate, an in-screen fingerprint sensor, and a dual selfie camera. At the back is a triple-camera setup with an all-new 50-megapixel RYYB main sensor. The phone runs Android 10 (without Google’s apps and services out of the box) available across Europe for 799 euros (starting price for 6GB RAM/128GB storage variant).

name: Huawei P40 Lite
description: Huawei P40 Lite sports a 6.4-inch Full HD+ display and a punch hole, housing the 16MP selfie shooter at the front. The quad-camera setup on the back includes a 48MP main sensor, an 8MP ultra-wide angle, one macro, and one depth sensor. Under the hood, the phone is powered by Kirin 810, 6GB RAM, 128 gigs of storage, and 4200mAh battery. The P40 Lite runs Android 10, but Google Mobile Services are not included.

name: Huawei Mate Xs
description: Considering the product's ridiculously high price tag (€2,499), the Huawei Mate Xs is crammed full of some of the latest mobile technology. Leading the way is the custom Kirin 990 5G with 512GB expandable internal storage and 8GB of RAM. This is combined with the company's outstanding 55W fast charging technology, allowing the 4,500mAh battery to be charged to 85% in just 30 minutes. The Huawei Mate Xs package is completed by a quad-camera setup on the back which houses a 40-megapixel main sensor, an 8-megapixel telephoto shooter, a 16-megapixel ultra-wide-angle alternative, and a Time-of-Flight sensor for accurate portrait photography.

name: Huawei Mate 30 RS Porsche Design
description: The Mate 30 RS Porsche Design is a special edition made in collaboration between Porsche Design and Huawei. The phone is different than the Mate 30 Pro 5G only on the outside.

name: Huawei Mate 30 5G
description: The Huawei Mate 30 5G comes along with the same specifications as the regular Mate 30. The only difference is the Kirin 990 5G chipset. Other specs like the 4,200mAh battery with fast 40W wired and 23W wireless charging support, triple rear camera on the back, 24MP selfie shooter are also available here.

name: Huawei Mate 30 Pro 5G
description: The Huawei Mate 30 Pro 5G shares the same specs as the regular Mate 30 Pro except for the 7nm Kirin 990 5G chipset. Other features like the 3D face unlock, optical in-display fingerprint scanner, quad-camera setup on the back, the super slo-mo videos at 7,680fps are also here. The phone starts at EUR 1,199.

name: Huawei Mate 30
description: The regular Huawei Mate 30 comes along with a flat OLED display that spans across 6.62 inches and has a FHD+ resolution. The 7nm Kirin 990 chipset is powering the phone, along with 8GB of RAM and 128GB of storage. The 4,200mAh battery supports fast 40W wired and 27W wireless charging. There is a triple rear camera on the back, consisting of a 16MP ultra wide-angle (with f/2.2 aperture), 40MP SuperSensing (f/1.8 aperture), and 8MP telephoto camera (f/2.4 aperture), plus a laser focusing sensor. For selfies, Huawei offers a capable 24MP shooter with f/2.0 aperture. The device starts at EUR 799.

name: Huawei Mate 30 Pro
description: Despite lacking Google’s apps and services out of the box, the Huawei Mate 30 Pro is one of the most impressive Android devices in terms of hardware. The 6.5-inch OLED display is curved at a rather steep 88-degree angle and has a FullHD+ resolution that helps get a better battery life out of the 4,500mAh battery that supports 40W wired and 27W wireless charging. The 7nm Kirin 990 chipset is running the show in tandem with 8GB of RAM and 256GB of storage. There’s 3D face unlock that’s similar to Apple’s FaceID, as well as an optical in-display fingerprint scanner. The Mate 30 Pro uses two 40MP camera sensors, as well as a 40MP main, 8MP telephoto, a 40MP ultra-wide, and a ToF camera. The phone can record slo-mo videos at 7,680fps. The Mate 30 Pro runs on Android 10 and EMUI 10. The phone starts at EUR 1,099.

name: Huawei nova 5T
description: The Huawei nova 5T brings a 6.26-inch display with FHD+ resolution and a punch hole for the 32 MP selfie cam. On the back, there is a quad-cam setup. Under the hood, the phone is powered by Kirin 980 SoC paired with 6 GB RAM and 128 GB storage, and 3,750mAh battery. The nova 5T surprisingly comes with full Google Services support.

name: Huawei P20 Lite (2019)
description: The Huawei P20 Lite (2019) have a 6.4-inch display, Kirin 710 processor coupled with 4 GB RAM and 128 gigs of storage, and a quad-camera setup on the back. The phone is powered by 4000 mAh battery.

name: Huawei P Smart Z
description: The Huawei P Smart Z features a 6.6-inch display with 1080 x 2340 pixels resolution, Kirin 710 processor and 64 GB expandable storage. There is a dual-camera setup on the back, while the front one is pop-up. The phone is powered by 4000 mAh battery and runs Android Pie.

name: Huawei P30 Pro
description: The Huawei P30 Pro aims to revolutionize photography with its quad-camera setup. At the back, you'll find a 40MP camera promising great low-light photography. Next to are found a wide-angle camera for shooting in tight spots and a powerful telephoto camera with 5x zoom. An additional time-of-flight camera provides detailed depth information for portrait photos. Cameras aside, the Huawei P30 Pro stands out with a fingerprint reader in the display, a large, 4200mAh battery, and a 6.5-inch OLED screen filling all its front. The Kirin 980 chip is backed by up to 8GB of RAM and 512GB of storage.

name: Huawei P30
description: The Huawei P30 is a high-end Android phone powered by Huawei's Kirin 980 chip, backed by up to 8GB of RAM and 128GB of storage. A key selling point is the triple camera at the back, comprised of a main, 40MP camera promising great low-light shots, a super wide-angle camera, and a telephoto camera with 3x zoom. The 6.1-inch OLED screen stretches from one corner to the other and is only interrupted by a small notch housing the front, 32MP camera. The 3650mAh battery charges rapidly and supports reverse wireless charging.

name: Huawei P30 Lite
description: The Huawei P30 Lite is a mid-range phone adopting the gradient color and edge-to-edge screen design seen on the company's high-end devices. It has a 6.2-inch LCD display, a 3340mAh battery with fast charging, and a mid-range Kirin 710 chip, paired with 4GB of RAM and 128GB of storage. The triple camera at the back is comprised of a main, 24MP sensor, a secondary 8MP wide-angle camera, and a third camera for gathering depth information.

name: Huawei Y7 (2019)
description: The Huawei Y7 (2019) sports a 6.3-inch display with waterdrop notch, Snapdragon 450 processor, dual-camera setup on the back and 4000 mAh battery.

name: Huawei P Smart+ (2019)
description: The Huawei P Smart+ (2019) specifications include a 6.2-inch screen with 1080 x 2340 pixels resolution, Kirin 710 processor with 3GB of RAM and a 24-megapixel triple-camera setup. The hone is powered by a 3400 mAh battery.

name: Huawei Y6 (2019)
description: The Huawei Y6 2019 sports a 6.1-inch display with 720 x 1560 pixels resolution, Helio A22 processor, 3020 mAh battery and Android 9.0 Pie.

name: Huawei Mate X
description: The Mate X is Huawei's first foldable smartphone with a display that folds in half. At its centerpiece, an OLED screen measures 6.6 inches in diagonal when folded, but offers twice the screen area when fully unfolded. The phone also stands out with support for 5G networks and for Huawei's 55W fast charging. On the hardware side, a Kirin 980 rocks the show, along with 8GB of RAM and the plentiful 512GB of storage. And the camera arrangement offers all the features one might wish for: a 40MP main shooter backed by a super wide-angle camera, a telephoto lens for zooming, and a ToF sensor for better depth perception.

name: Huawei P Smart (2019)
description: The Huawei P Smart (2019) sports a 6.2-inch display with 2340 x 1080 pixels resolution, and waterdrop notch. Under the hood is Kirin 710 SOC with 3 GB of RAM and 64 GB of storage. Android 9.0 Pie is pre-installed out of the box.

name: Huawei Mate 20 RS Porsche Design
description: The Huawei Mate 20 RS Porsche Design is for those who don't mind spending $2000 on a smartphone. Like the Mate 20 Pro, it comes with a lot of high-tech goodies, including an in-screen fingerprint scanner, 3D face-recognition biometric security, a triple camera with wide-angle and optical zoom lenses, and a huge, 4200mAh battery with rapid charging. What sets it apart, however, is the fancier design, as the back is made of leather with a strip of glass down the middle. Tons of memory and pre-installed Porsche-inspired UI themes complete the premium package.

name: Huawei Mate 20
description: The Huawei Mate 20 easily stands out from the crowd thanks to its metal-and-glass construction and flashy gradient color options. But the phone has a lot more going for it: a spacious, high-brightness LCD display occupies nearly all of its front side, while a triple camera with 2x zoom and wide-angle lenses gives you plenty of creative freedom. On top of that, the huge, 4000mAh battery is among the biggest on a phone of this class.

name: Huawei Mate 20 X
description: The Huawei Mate 20 X brings top of the line specs to the table. The front of the device is occupied by the massive 7.2-inch AMOLED panel and the 24-megapixel front-facing camera. On the back, there is a triple camera solution consisting of a 40-megapixel main sensor, 20-megapixel wide-angle unit and a 3x zoom 8-megapixel telephoto lens with OIS. The device is powered by a 7nm Kirin 980 octa-core chip, 6 GB of RAM and 128 GB of storage.

name: Huawei Mate 20 Pro
description: The Mate 20 Pro is Huawei's answer to the iPhone XS Max. It sports a large, high-res OLED display with a notch at the top housing a face-recognition system similar to the iPhone's Face ID. In addition, the Huawei Mate 20 Pro is one of the first phones with an in-display fingerprint reader. At the back, a triple camera with 3x zoom and wide-angle lenses gives you plenty of creative freedom. The phone's huge, 4200 mAh battery can be charged from zero to 70% in 30 minutes thanks to a super-fast, 40W charging system.

name: Huawei Y9 (2019)
description: The Huawei Y9 (2019) comes with a 6.5-inch notched LCD display with 1080 x 2340 pixels resolution and 19.5:9 aspect ratio. More importantly, the phone is equipped with a mid-range Kirin 710 processor, coupled with either 4GB or 6GB RAM and either 64GB or 128GB internal memory. Another selling point is the fact that it packs four cameras, two on the back (13MP+2MP) and two (16MP+2MP) on the front side, both featuring Huawei's AI photography technology.

name: Huawei Mate 20 lite
description: Huawei Mate 20 Lite packs a 2.2GHz octa-core Kirin 710 processor, 4GB RAM, and 64GB internal storage. Unsurprisingly, the Mate 20 Lite has four cameras – two in the front and two on the back side. The dual rear camera features a 20MP and a 2MP cameras, while in the front there's a 24MP snapper and another 2MP camera for depth effects. The phablet will run Android 8.0 Oreo, powered by a 3,750 mAh battery.

name: Huawei nova 3i
description: The Huawei nova 3i comes with a 6.3-inch display, Kirin 710 octa-core processor, 4GB of RAM, 128 GB of storage. On the back there is a dual-camera setup consisting of a 16-megapixel main sensor and a 2-megapixel secondary. On the front there is a beefy 24-megapixel snapper backed up by a 2-megapixel unit.

name: Huawei nova 3
description: The Huawei nova 3 comes with a 6.3-inch display, 2.36 GHz octa-core processor, 4/6 GB of RAM and 128 GB of storage (expandable via microSD). On the back there is a dual-camera setup consisting of a 16-megapixel F/1.8 main sensor and a 24-megapixel monochrome secondary unit. On the front there is another 24-megapixel camera but this time shoots in color, backed up by a 2-megapixel snapper.

name: Huawei Y5 Prime (2018)
description: The Huawei Y5 Prime (2018) comes with a 5.45-inch display, 1.5 GHz quad-core processor, 2 GB of RAM, 16 GB of storage (expandable via microSD) and a 13-megapixel  camera.

name: Huawei Y6 (2018)
description: Huawei Y6 (2018) is a budget Android phone that features a 5.7-inch HD+ display, Snapdragon 425 SOC and 16 gigs of expandable storage. The phone is powered by 3000mAh battery and runs Android Oreo 8.0.

name: Huawei Y7 Prime (2018)
description: The Huawei Y7 Prime (2018) sports a tall 18:9 display with 1440x720 resolution.The phone has a dual rear camera setup on its back, and an 8-megapixel selfie snapper at the front. The Y7 Prime (2018) is powered by Qualcomm's Snapdragon 430 SoC, 3GB of RAM and 32GB of expandable storage. It runs Android 8.0 Oreo.

name: Huawei Mate RS Porsche Design
description: Huawei Mate RS Porsche Design adopts many of the features seen on the high-end Huawei P20 Pro: the triple camera arrangement, the massive, 4000mAh battery, and the Kirin 970 chip. On top of that, it adds a fancy 6-inch OLED display with curves at the sides and a fingerprint reader built right into it. You also get dual speakers, fast wireless charging, up to 512GB of storage and space-grade cooling for optimum performance – all for a price between $2000 and $2500.

name: Huawei P20 Pro
description: The Huawei P20 Pro is a phone that stands out with its large, spacious display and its triple camera at the back. Its huge screen occupies most of its front, with a notch at the top housing the earpiece and front-facing camera. The triple camera arrangement is comprised of a massive, 40MP camera for regular shots, a 3X zoom telephoto cam, and a monochrome sensor enabling bokeh effects. On the inside is a powerful Kirin 970 chip, along with plenty of memory and a huge battery.

name: Huawei P20
description: Huawei P20 is a high-end Android-powered phone with a large, spacious screen at its centerpiece. Like it or not, a notch at the display's top houses the 24MP front-facing camera and the earpiece, while at the back is a 12+20MP dual camera enabling bokeh effects.

name: Huawei P20 Lite
description: Huawei P20 Lite hosts a 5.84" LCD screen with 1080 x 2280 pixels resolution, returning the robust 423ppi pixel density - well, apart from the top screen cutout, of course. The notch has allowed Huawei to keep the dimensions of the P20 Lite very, very compact. It also houses the 16MP selfie snapper and sensors that allow Huawei to implement a Face Unlock feature of sorts, logging in 96 face points. There is a 16MP main camera at the back as well, which is paired with depth-sensing 2MP shooter for "bokeh". Unfortunately, the middling Kirin 659 processor gets confirmed. There are no compromises with the memory situation, though, as the phone will ship in a 4GB/64GB setup, or with the software level, as it comes with the latest Android 8.0 Oreo.

name: Huawei P Smart
description: Huawei P Smart carries a 5.65-inch LCD display with a resolution of 1080 x 2160. That works out to an aspect ratio of 18:9. The device is powered by the home-grown Kirin 659 chipset, which includes an octa-core CPU. Two versions of the handset will be offered. One comes with 3GB of RAM and 32GB of native storage. The other model features 4GB of RAM along with 64GB of native storage.

name: Huawei Mate 10 Lite
description: Huawei Mate 10 Lite is notable for being the only mid-ranger in the Mate 10 series, as it’s the only one to be powered by the Kirin 659 SoC. It display is a 5.9-inch 18:9 panel with a resolution of 1080 x 2160 pixels. Its most interesting aspect, however, are its cameras: both the device’s rear and front use dual cameras. The rear has a 16 MP main sensor, while the front uses a 13 MP one, with both of those being complemented by a secondary 2 MP sensor used for taking bokeh photos. The battery capacity is rated at a fairly decent 3,340 mAh.

name: Huawei Mate 10 Porsche Design
description: Huawei Mate 10 Porsche Edition is in reality the same device as the Mate 10 Pro, but with a slightly different rear panel design, 256 GB internal storage and some minor software tweaks. As such it also features a 6-inch, 18:9 display with a resolution of 1080x2160 pixels. Its rear camera module consists of two sensors: a 12-megapixel color one, and a 20-megapixel monochrome one, with both of them having a f1.6 lens. Notable omissions are the headphone jack and the microSD card slot found in the regular Mate 10 model. Present inside is the brand-new Kirin 970 SoC, which features a dedicated neural processing unit designed for use in various AI tasks.

name: Huawei Mate 10
description: Out of the entire Mate 10 series, the regular Huawei Mate 10 stands out as the most conventional device, thanks to its conventional 5.9-inch, 16:9 display with a resolution of 1440x2560 pixels. The dual cameras of its predecessor are making a return, with a 12-megapixel color sensor and a 20-megapixel monochrome one. Both of cameras also feature a f1.6 lens, the current lowest option on the market. On the inside, the device is powered by the brand-new Kirin 970 SoC, which features a dedicated neural processing unit designed for use in various AI tasks. On board you’ll also find an impressive battery capacity of 4,000 mAh, an SD card slot, and a headphone jack.

name: Huawei Mate 10 Pro
description: Huawei Mate 10 Pro is noteworthy for being Huawei’s first flagship sporting a display with a tall aspect ratio, with a 6-inch, 18:9 panel with a resolution of 1080x2160 pixels. It has a dual rear camera module consisting of a 12-megapixel color sensor and a 20-megapixel monochrome one, with both of those having a f1.6 lens. Notably missing are the headphone jack and microSD card slot found in its sibling, but the impressive 4,000 mAh battery capacity is still present. On the inside, the device is powered by the brand-new Kirin 970 SoC, which features a dedicated neural processing unit used in various scenarios requiring the use of machine learning.

name: Huawei Y6 Pro (2017)
description: Huawei Y6 Pro (2017) is equipped with a 1.4GHz quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 425 processor, accompanied with 2GB RAM and 16GB expandable storage. The phone retains the same 5-inch display with HD (720p) resolution (as its predecessor's one), but runs a newer Android 7.0 Nougat operating system with EMUI 5.1 on top. Surprisingly, the smartphone has a rear-mounted fingerprint sensor, along with 13-megapixel primary and secondary 5-megapixel selfie cameras.

name: Huawei nova 2i
description: The new nova 2i is solid mid-ranger that flaunts a huge 5.9-inch FullView display with 18:9 ratio and full HD (1080p) resolution. On the inside, the smartphone packs a powerful Kirin 659 processor, 4GB RAM, and 64GB expandable storage. The phone comes with four cameras, two on the front (13MP+2MP) and two on the back side (16MP+2MP). The Nova 2i is powered by a 3,340 mAh battery and runs Android Nougat with EMUI 5.1 on top.

name: Huawei P9 lite mini
description: Huawei P9 lite mini is a mid-range smartphone that's smaller than the regular P9 lite. Unlike the Huawei P9 lite that sports a 5.2-inch full HD display, the mini version comes with a smaller 5-inch display with HD (720p) resolution. Hardware-wise, the P9 lite mini has a 1.4GHz quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 425 processor, along with 2GB RAM and 16GB expandable storage. The phone retains the same 13-megapixel rear-facing camera on the P9 lite, but the 5-megapixel (down from 8-megapixel) selfie camera is different.

name: Huawei nova 2 Plus
description: Huawei nova 2 Plus is a mid-ranger that features a 5.5-inch full HD (1080p) display and a massive 3340 mAh battery. Also, the smartphone is powered by an octa-core HiSilicon Kirin 659 processor, paired with 4GB RAM and 64GB internal memory. More importantly, the Nova 2 is a cheaper alternative for those who absolutely must own a smartphone with a dual-camera setup. Huawei's handset comes with 12-megapixel and 8-megapixel cameras on the back, along with an impressive 20-megapixel selfie camera.

name: Huawei nova 2

More importantly, the nova 2 is a cheaper alternative for those who absolutely must own a smartphone with a dual-camera setup. name: Huawei Y7 Prime
description: Huawei Y7 Prime sports 5.5-inch HD display, fingerprint sensor and enormous 4000mAh battery. Under the hood is situated an octa-core processor with 3 GB RAM and 32 gigs of expandable storage. The phone runs Android 7.0.

name: Asus ROG Phone 5 Ultimate
description: The Asus ROG Phone 5 Ultimate features a custom-made 6.78-inch AMOLED display with a 144Hz refresh rate. The ROG Phone 5 Ultimate comes equipped with the latest Snapdragon chipset - the 888 with an overclocked Adreno 660 GPU that delivers 35% better performance compared to the last generation of ROG Phone. Specs also include 18GB RAM with 512GB internal storage, 6000mAh battery and triple setup camera on the back.

name: Asus ZenFone 8 Flip
description: The ZenFone 8 Flip specs include a 6.67-inch AMOLED display, Snapdragon 888 processor, 8GB RAM, and 128/256GB storage. name: Asus ZenFone 8
description: Asus ZenFone 8 comes with 5.9-inch FHD+ AMOLED display with 120Hz refresh rate and Qualcomm Snapdragon 888 processor. Specifications also include 4000mAh battery with 30W charging speed, dual camera setup on the back with 64MP main sensor and 12MP selfie camera on the front.

name: Asus ROG Phone 5
description: The Asus ROG Phone 5 models feature a custom-made 6.78-inch E4 AMOLED panel from Samsung with FHD+ resolution and a 144Hz refresh rate. The ROG Phone 5 comes equipped with the latest Snapdragon chipset - the 888 with an overclocked Adreno 660 GPU that delivers 35% better performance compared to the last generation of ROG Phone. We all know that RAM is important for gamers and the ROG Phone 5 has an insane amount of it. The Ultimate model features 18GB of RAM - more than many modern PC gaming rigs out there. The Pro and Ultimate models also feature 512GB of internal storage, while the vanilla ROG Phone 5 offers a range of RAM and storage options - starting from 8GB/128GB and going up to 16GB/256GB.

name: Asus ZenFone 7
description: Asus ZenFone 7 specs include a 6.67-inch AMOLED display, Snapdragon 865 processor, 6/8GB RAM, and 128GB storage. Responsible for keeping the lights up, is a 5000mAh battery. In the camera department - the same triple flip system form the Pro model is available, except for the lack of OIS.

name: Asus ZenFone 7 Pro
description: The ZenFone 7 Pro specs include a 6.67-inch edge-to-edge display, Snapdragon 865+ processor, 8GB RAM, and 256GB storage. The phone sports a flip camera system consisting of three sensors - a 64MP main camera, a 12MP ultra-wide camera, and the third one is 8MP telephoto. The Asus ZenFone 7 Pro is powered by 5000mAh battery and Android 10 out of the box.

name: Asus ROG Phone 3 Strix Edition
description: Asus ROG Phone 3 Strix Edition specifications includes a Snapdragon 865+ chipset with 8GB RAM, and 256GB storage, 6.6-inch AMOLED display with 144Hz refresh rate and 6000mAh battery. In-screen fingerprint, 5G support, and Android 10 are also present. There is a triple camera setup on the back, as well as 24MP selfie shooter on the front.

name: Asus ROG Phone 3
description: Asus ROG Phone 3 specifications include a 6.6-inch AMOLED display with 144Hz refresh rate, Snapdragon 865+ processor with up to 16GB RAM, and 512GB storage, and 6000mAh battery. In-screen fingerprint, 5G support, and Android 10 will are also presented. There is a triple camera setup on the back, as well as 24MP selfie shooter at the front.

name: Asus ROG Phone II
description: The ASUS ROG Phone 2 is second-generation gaming phone with over-the-top aesthetics and impressively awesome hardware.

name: Asus ZenFone 6 (2019)
description: The Asus ZenFone 6 (2019) specifications include a 6.4-inch IPS display, Snapdragon 855 processor and 8 GB RAM. There is a dual-camera setup ( with 48-megapixel main sensor ) on the back, that rotates to take great selfies. The phone is powered by a massive 5000 mAh battery and runs Android 9.0 Pie.

name: Asus ZenFone Live (L2)
description: The Asus ZenFone Live (L2) is a minor upgrade over the ZenFone Live (L1). The specifications include a 5.5-inch display, Snapdragon 430 processor, and 13-megapixel camera with PDAF. A 3000 mAh battery is powering the device and Android 8.1 Oreo is on board.

name: Asus ZenFone Max Pro (M2)
description: The Asus ZenFone Max Pro (M2)  sports a 6.3-inch screen with 2280 x 1080 resolution, Snapdragon 660 SOC and 6 GB RAM. A dual-camera setup and a fingerprint reader are situated on the back. The phone is powered by a gargantuan 5,000 mAh battery.

name: Asus ZenFone Max (M2)
description: The Asus ZenFone Max (M2) sports a 6.3-inch screen with 720 x 15200 resolution, Snapdragon 632 SOC and 4 GB RAM. A dual-camera setup and a fingerprint reader are situated on the back. The phone is powered by 4000mAh battery and runs Android Oreo out of the box.

name: Asus ZenFone Live (L1)
description: The Asus ZenFone Live (L1) comes with a 5.5-inch 18:9 display, 1/2 GB of RAM, 16 GB of storage (expandable via microSD). The camera department is covered by a 13-megapixel main shooter (there is also a variant with 8-megapixels) and a 5-megapixel front facing unit.

name: Asus ROG Phone
description: The Asus ROG Phone is unmistakably a gamer device. A full metal body with a glass back is accented throughout with aggressive-looking streaks and lines. Two speakers on the front deliver stereo sound. An octa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 845 clocked at 2.96 GHz ticks inside, a generous 8 GB of RAM chip takes care of multitasking, and you've got a choice between 128 GB and 512 GB of storage. There's a dual camera module on the back — a 12 MP main camera and an 8 MP secondary camera with a 120-degree wide-angle lens. On the front, there's an 8 MP snapper. All of this is kept on by a rather generous 4,000 mAh battery.The display is an 18:9 AMOLED panel with the super-impressive refresh rate of 90 Hz.

name: Asus ZenFone Max Pro (M1)
description: Asus ZenFone Max Pro looks pretty decent thanks to the 6-inch display with full HD+ (1080 x 2160 pixels) resolution, Qualcomm Snapdragon 636 processor, and massive 5,000 mAh battery. On the back, the phone includes a dual-camera setup (13MP+5MP) and a fingerprint sensor, while in the front there's a secondary 8-megapixel selfie camera.

name: Asus ZenFone Max (M1)
description: Sporting a 5.5-inch display with 720 x 1440 pixels and a modern 18:9 aspect ratio, the Asus ZenFone Max (M1) packs a large 4,000 mAh battery. Other features include face unlock, dual SIM support, a Qualcomm Snapdragon 425 processor, 2 GB of RAM, and 16 GB of expandable storage space. On the back, the phone has a fingerprint scanner and a dual camera (13 MP + wide-angle 8 MP), while the front hosts an 8 MP selfie camera.

name: Asus ZenFone 5 (ZE620KL)
description: Asus ZenFone 5 is powered by Snapdragon 636, and two different tiers — 64 GB of storage + 4 GB of RAM or 64 GB of storage + 6 GB of RAM. At the front ZenFone 5 sports a 6.2-inch IPS screen with a 19:9 aspect ratio. The resolution we get is FHD+ (1080 x 2280) to make for some crisp imagery. In the camera department we have a dual setup on the back — a main 12 MP sensor with huge 1.4 μm pixels and a rather large lens aperture of F1.8 takes care for most scenarios. Then, there's the secondary snapper with an 8 MP sensor and a 120-degree wide-angle lens for those larger-than-life shots. On the front, we've got an 8 MP selfie camera.

name: Asus ZenFone 5Q
description: Asus ZenFone 5Q sports a 6-inch 18:9 IPS screen and a FHD+ resolution of 1080 x 2160 pixels. The phone rocks a Snapdragon 630 with 4 of RAM and offers 64 GB of storage. Furthermore the ZenFone 5Q has four cameras — two in the back and two in the front. Both sides have a “regular” and a wide-angle lenses. The main camera on the back has a 16 MP sensor, while the front one has a 20 MP one for those super-detailed selfies.

name: Asus ZenFone 5z
description: Asus ZenFone 5Z proudly trots into flagship land with a Snapdragon 845, and three different tiers — 64 GB of storage + 4 GB of RAM, 128 GB of storage + 6 GB of RAM, or 256 GB of storage + 8 GB of RAM. At the front ZenFone 5Z sports a 6.2-inch IPS screen with a 19:9 aspect ratio. The resolution we get is FHD+ (1080 x 2280) to make for some crisp imagery. In the camera department we have a dual setup on the back — a main 12 MP sensor with huge 1.4 μm pixels and a rather large lens aperture of F1.8 takes care for most scenarios. Then, there's the secondary snapper with an 8 MP sensor and a 120-degree wide-angle lens for those larger-than-life shots. On the front, we've got an 8 MP selfie camera.

name: Asus ZenFone Max Plus (M1)
description: Besides the large 5.7-inch full HD+ (1080 x 2160 pixels) display, the Asus ZenFone Max Plus (M1) packs a massive 4,130 mAh battery. The octa-core MediaTek 6750T processor is paired with either 3GB RAM and 32GB internal memory, or 4GB RAM and 64GB storage. The back side features a dual-camera setup (16MP+8MP), while in the front there's an 8-megapixel selfie camera.

name: Asus ZenFone V Live
description: The Asus ZenFone V Live is a budget priced handset that features a 5-inch display made with slightly curved 2.5D glass, carrying a 720 x 1280 HD resolution. The phone is powered by the Snapdragon 425 chipset, which comes with a quad-core CPU and the Adreno 308 GPU. 2GB of RAM is inside, along with 16GB of native storage.

name: Asus ZenFone V
description: The Asus ZenFone V is a respectable handset, as it packs a Snapdragon 820 processor (found inside many flagships of 2016), 4 GB of RAM, and 32 GB of expandable storage space. The smartphone sports a 5.2-inch AMOLED display with 1080 x 1920 pixels, further offering an 8 MP front-facing camera, a 23 MP rear camera with OIS (optical image stabilization), Smart AMP technology (for louder speaker sound), fingerprint scanner, and a 3000 mAh battery with fast charging.

name: Asus ZenFone 4 Selfie
description: Even though dual cameras are 2017's biggest trend, few companies have dared equip a device with such a module on the front instead of the back. And yet this is precisely what Asus is doing with the Selfie. The Asus ZenFone Selfie opts for a 20 MP selfie shooter, accompanied with secondary 8-megapixels wide-angle sensor. Apart from that, the rest of the specs are decidedly mid-range: Snapdragon 430 with 4 GB of RAM and a 3,000 mAh battery.

name: Asus ZenFone 4 Max
description: The highlight of the Asus ZenFone 4 Max is undoubtedly the 5000mAh battery. The phone completes with Snapdragon 430 SOC, 4 GB of RAM, a 5.5-inch HD display, and a 13 MP dual rear-facing camera.

name: Asus ZenFone 4 Pro
description: Asus has once again made the curious decision to bury its highest-specced smartphone behind a derivative name: last year we had the ZenFone 3 Deluxe, and now there's the ZenFone 4 Pro. But while its moniker might suggest otherwise, the device is actually quite an interesting one: it's powered by Qualcomm's Snapdragon 835, coupled with 6 GB of RAM and an impressive 3,6000 mAh battery. But the highlight of the device is most definitely its rear cameras: 12 MP shooter with optical iamge stabilization and PDAF, and a second 16-megapixels sensor for 2x optical zoom.

name: Asus ZenFone 4
description: The ASUS ZenFone 4 comes with a Snapdragon 660, 6 GB of RAM and a 3,300 mAh battery. But the highlight of the device is most definitely its rear cameras: 12 MP shooter with optical iamge stabilization and PDAF, and a second 8-megapixels wide angle sensor.

name: Asus ZenFone 4 Selfie Pro
description: Even though dual cameras are 2017's biggest trend, few companies have dared equip a device with such a module on the front instead of the back. And yet this is precisely what Asus is doing with the Selfie Pro. The ZenFone Selfie Pro opts for a 24 MP selfie shooter (though the sensor is technically a 12 MP one), accompanied with secondary 8-megapixels wide-angle sensor. Apart from that, the rest of the specs are decidedly mid-range: Snapdragon 625 with 3 or 4 GB of RAM and a 3,000 mAh battery.

name: Asus ZenFone Live
description: Asus says that the Zenfone Live is "the world's first smartphone with hardware-optimized, real-time beautification technology, making it possible to share an even more glamorous version of yourself - Live!" Essentially, the Zenfone Live will allow you to livestream video to Facebook, YouTube, and "other popular streaming apps" while having a beautification filter applied to your profile the entire time. Other specs are rather mediocre including a Snapdragon 410 processor, 2GB of RAM, and a 5-inch display with a resolution of 1280 x 720p HD.

name: Asus Zenfone 3s Max
description: The Asus Zenfone 3s Max features a 5.2-inch 720p display, MediaTek MT6750 SOC with 3GB of RAM and 32 gigs of internal storage (expandable via microSD card). There is a 13-megapixels main camera with PDAF on the back, as well as a 8-megapixels wide-angle front shooter. The phone is powered by 5000mAh battery and runs Android Nougat.

name: Realme X3 SuperZoom

name: OPPO Find N2 Flip

description: The OnePlus Nord CE 5G specifications include Qualcomm Snapdragon 750G processor, 6.43-inch AMOLED display with 90Hz refresh rate and triple camera setup on the back with 64MP main shooter combined with 16MP front selfie camera. Prices start from €299

name: OnePlus 9
description: OnePlus 9 packs a 6.5-inch screen with a 20:9 ratio and a resolution of 2400 x 1080. It’s an OLED panel with vivid colors and a 120 Hz refresh rate. It has a quad camera setup of which the main snapper is 48MP's and the one above it is a 50 MP ultra-wide camera. The chipset is a Qualcomm Snapdragon 888 and the OnePlus 9 can come with either 8 GB of RAM and 128 GB of storage, or 12 GB of RAM with 256 GB of storage. No microSD slot on board.

name: OnePlus 9 Pro
description: Pound-for-pound, the OnePlus 9 Pro is easily one of the best-specced Android phones announced so far in 2021. With the new Snapdragon 888 on board, the OnePlus 9 Pro is a beast in terms of processing, seemingly always in excess of processing power. You can have the phone with either 8 or 12GB of RAM, and 128 or 256GB of native storage without any expansion options, which is a pretty standard and mostly sufficient loadout for Android flagships these days. There is a 6.7-inch AMOLED display on board and a a triple camera that utilizes a new 50MP ultra-wide, wide-angle, and telephoto cameras.

name: OnePlus Nord N10
description: OnePlus Nord N10 specs include a 6.5-inch display with a 90Hz refresh rate, Snapdragon 690 processor, 6GB RAM with 128GB storage, and 4300mAh battery. Unlike other OnePlus smartphones, the Nord N10 5G supports microSD cards of up to 512GB. There is a quad-camera setup on the back with a 64MP main sensor, while at the front is positioned a 16MP selfie shooter. The OnePlus Nord N10 price is $300.

name: OnePlus Nord N100
description: The Nord N100 looks almost identical to the Nord N10 5G, but there are some subtle changes. The phone sports a 6.52-inch display, Snapdragon 460 processor, 4GB RAM with 64GB storage, and a massive 5000mAh battery. The microSD card slot is also presented here. As for the camera department - three cameras on the back with a 13MP main sensor and an 8MP camera at the front. The OnePlus Nord N100 price is $179.

name: OnePlus 8T
description: OnePlus 8T is the upgraded version of the Oneplus 8 with slight improvements in the hardware department. Most notable of all is the 120Hz flat AMOLED screen. Other specs include Snapdragon 865 processor, 12GB RAM with 256GB storage, and 4500mAh battery. Sadly, only the T-Mobile version will come with an IP68 rating. The OnePlus 8T price is $750.

name: OnePlus Nord
description: The OnePlus Nord specifications include a 6.44-inch Fluid AMOLED display with 90Hz refresh rate, Snapdragon 765G chipset with 8/12GB RAM, and 128/256 gigs of storage. There is a quad-camera setup on the back, while the front is occupied by a dual-sensor selfie shooter. The phone is powered by 4115mAh battery and Android 10, while 5G network connectivity is offered as standard. The OnePlus Nord is available for starting price of 399 Euros.

name: OnePlus 8 UW
description: OnePlus 8 UW is essentially a standard OnePlus 8 locked for Verizon, but there are some major differences. The Verizon OnePlus 8 UW covers all bands of 5G spectrum -  the low, mid, and high-band. That’s all sub-6 and mmWave 5G. Another significant difference is that the phone has an IP68 rating for water and dust resistance. Other hardware remains the same. The handset is available in exclusive Polar sIlver color and costs $800.

name: OnePlus 8
description: OnePlus 8 is a 5G-ready device that sports a 6.55-inch FHD+ AMOLED display that uses a 90Hz refresh rate, a Snapdragon 865 chipset with either 8 or 12GB of RAM, as well as ultra-fast storage, with either 128 or 256GB of capacity. The device comes with a 4,300mAh battery, ultra fast-charging, and a triple camera setup. Prices start at $699 and $799 for the 8/128 and 12/256GB versions respectively.

name: OnePlus 8 Pro
description: The OnePlus 8 Pro is a 5G-ready device that comes with a 6.78-inch QHD+ AMOLED display with 120Hz refresh rate, a Snapdragon 865 chipset with either 8 or 12GB of RAM, as well as fast storage with either 128 or 256GB of capacity. There's a 4,510mAh battery, and a quad-camera setup. There's official IP certification (only the version for T-Mobile), as well as wireless charging, for the first time on an OnePlus phone. Prices start at $899 and $999 for the 8/128 and 12/256GB versions.

name: OnePlus 7T Pro 5G McLaren
description: The OnePlus 7T Pro 5G McLaren Edition features a  notch-less 6.67-inch Fluid AMOLED display with a 1440 x 3120 resolution. The phone carries a 90Hz screen and is powered by the overclocked Snapdragon 855+ chipset. The OnePlus 7T Pro 5G McLaren Edition is equipped with 12GB of memory and 256GB of storage. There is a triple-camera set up in the back (48MP primary + 16MP ultra-wide+8MP telephoto). A 4085mAh battery keeps the lights on and charges quickly with Warp Charge 30T. The McLaren is priced at $899.99.

name: OnePlus 7T Pro
description: The OnePlus 7T Pro introduces minor updates to the specs of the powerful Android phone from H1 2019. The new device will come with the improved Qualcomm Snapdragon 855 Plus chipset, which has much better GPU capabilities compared to its predecessor. A marginally larger battery weighing at 4,085mAh will be powering the phone. The OnePlus 7T Pro is also expected to arrive with OxygenOS based on the new Android 10 right out of the box. There also is a OnePlus 7T Pro McLaren Edition, which comes with a unique paint job and 12 GB of RAM.

name: OnePlus 7T
description: The OnePlus 7T combines all the best features of the OnePlus 7 Pro and the design of the OnePlus 7. It comes with a speedy Snapdragon 855+ chipset, 8GB of RAM, a 3800mAh battery, Warp Charge 30T fast-charging, and circular triple camera setup. A 6.55-inch Fluid AMOLED display with a FHD+ resolution and a 20:9 aspect ratio sits at the front. There's an embedded fingerprint scanner in the display, as well as facial unlock. The main 48MP camera has an f/1.6 aperture, the 2X telephoto one weighs in at 12MP, and the ultra-wide-angle lens is a 16MP f/2.2 one.

name: OnePlus 7 Pro 5G
description: The OnePlus 7 Pro 5G shares the same specifications as the regular 7 Pro model except for the Snapdragon X50 modem that enables 5G connectivity.

name: OnePlus 7 Pro
description: The OnePlus 7 Pro comes with a 16MP motorized pop-up camera and a 6.7” OLED display with a resolution of 1440 by 3120 pixels with a smooth 90Hz refresh rate. The phone is powered by the Snapdragon 855 chipset and 6,8, or 12GB of RAM. The triple camera setup at the back consists of a main 48MP camera aided by 8MP telephoto and 16MP ultra-wide snappers. There is 128 or 256GB of non-expandable native storage and a 4,000mAh battery supporting OnePlus’ Warp/Dash Charge. There’s no headphone jack and no wireless charging. OnePlus has introduced a new haptic vibration engine, which allows for better feedback when the user interacts with the interface. The device is available in three colors--Mirror gray, Nebula blue, Almond--and starts at $669.

name: OnePlus 7
description: Just like previous OnePlus phones, OnePlus 7 is a high-end device at a reasonable price. The phone comes with the powerful Snapdragon 855 chip, 8 RAM and 256 GB of storage. There is a dual-camera setup on the back, as well as a 16-megapixel front shooter. The Oneplus 7 is powered by 3700 mAh battery.

name: OnePlus 6T
description: The OnePlus 6T is powerful, yet reasonably priced Android phone. Starting at $550, it offers top-of-the-line specs, including a Snapdragon 845 and up to 8GB of RAM. It is also one of the few smartphones with a fingerprint scanner built right into the display. On the lists of skipped features are a headphone jack, water resistance, and wireless charging. The OnePlus 6T is the company's first to launch through a US carrier, namely T-Mobile.

name: OnePlus 6
description: As all of the company's previous high-end smartphones, the OnePlus 6 offers great specs at a great price. A tall, 6.3-inch AMOLED display is at its centerpiece, a dual-camera setup enables bokeh effects and high-framerate video, and a Snapdragon 845 provides plenty of processing power. The lightweight user interface has a stock feel, but also brings useful extras like Face Unlock and optional navigation gestures to replace on-screen buttons. The phone is made of glass and metal and is resistant to rain and splashes.

name: OnePlus 5T
description: OnePlus 5T features an immersive 6" 18:9 AMOLED display and a new dual camera system on the back that will help it take better pictures in low light. It can also take Portrait Mode photos with a blurred background.The fingerprint scanner is on the back and the phone also supports Face Unlock. Good old features like the 3.5mm headphone jack and Dash Charger, the company's quick charging solution, are still present on the 5T as well.

name: OnePlus 5
description: Like previous OnePlus smartphones, the OnePlus 5 aims to deliver a flagship smartphone experience at a competitive price. It combines tons of memory and the best Snapdragon chip currently available with Google's latest Android version further optimized by OnePlus itself. But the biggest highlight of the OnePlus 5 is its dual camera, allowing you to zoom in without dramatic loss in quality. It also comes with an iPhone-like portrait mode, with background blur for subject emphasis. But with a price between $480 and $540, the OnePlus 5 is also the company's most expensive phone so far.

name: OnePlus 3T
description: OnePlus 3T comes as an upgraded variant of the highly acclaimed OnePlus 3. As such, it brings more than just a new Gunmetal color option. The 3T is packed with a 13% larger battery, a slightly faster processor, a higher-resolution front-facing camera, a 128GB storage variant, and 6GB of RAM as standard. While the main camera remains largely unchanged, it now has a sapphire glass cover and improved video recording capabilities. As expected, the OnePlus 3T runs the Android-based OxygenOS interface, which builds on top of stock Android by adding features like Night Mode and UI theme support. The OnePlus 3T starts at a very competitive $439 in the US.

name: OnePlus 3
description: OnePlus 3 is an Android smartphone delivering high-end specs at a reasonable price without compromising design and without making you wait in queue to get one. We're talking a large, high-res display, the fastest Qualcomm SoC, a 16MP Sony camera, and tons of RAM and storage. The large, 3000mAh battery can be recharged rapidly via Dash Charge and the provided charger. If you want to get one, the OnePlus 3 can be purchased invitation-free from the company's website.

name: OnePlus X
description: The external appearance is undoubtedly one of the main selling points for the new OnePlus X. The phone will be offered in two versions - Onyx and a limited Ceramic edition. The phone has a 5-inch display with 1080p resolution and 441ppi. The real eyebrow-raiser with the OnePlus X is its quad-core Snapdragon 801 chipset. Not that this silicon is not powerful enough to run the new Oxygen interface on top of Android 5.1.1 Lollipop, but it is somewhat aging in the sense that it is not a 64-bit endeavor. Other than that, OnePlus equipped the X with a generous 3 GB RAM amount, and 16 GB of storage, expandable via a microSD card, the slot for which is housed in the dual SIM card tray, so it's either two nano SIMs, or one SIM and one memory card, bummer. The OnePlus X comes with a 13 MP rear camera, and a hearty 8 MP selfie-taker.

name: OnePlus 2
description: The OnePlus 2 is an incremental step in terms of overall design language. The frame is a magnesium and aluminum alloy, which should keep weight in check, and provide a high-quality feel to the physical build of the device. On its left side is a new hardware feature called the “alert slider.” It’s a 3-stop sliding button allowing for quick switching between sound and notification profiles, making it easy to silence your phone in a hurry. The OnePlus 2 is a dual-SIM device, and it features a USB Type-C plug. The larger male USB plug is also reversible, and is patented by OnePlus. Switching out back plates is easier now with “StyleSwap” covers. OnePlus will have four new StyleSwap options available should you not prefer their signature Sandstone cover.

name: Vivo X90 Pro+

name: Vivo NEX 3
description: The vivo NEX 3 carries a 6.89-inch POLED Waterfall display with an FHD+ resolution. The phone is powered by the overclocked Snapdragon 855+ coupled with 8GB RAM and 256GB of storage. The triple-camera setup on back includes a 64MP primary camera with an f/1.8 aperture, a 13MP ultra-wide camera, and a 13MP telephoto camera. A pop-up 16MP selfie snapper helps the screen-to-body-ratio stay high. There is an in-display fingerprint scanner and a 4500mAh capacity battery keeps the lights on.

name: Vivo V15 Pro
description: The vivo V15 Pro specifications include a 6.4-inch Super AMOLED display with 1080 x 2316 pixels resolution, Snapdragon 675 processor with 6 GB RAM, and triple setup rear camera with 48-megapixel main sensor. The phone is powered by 3700 mAh battery.

name: Vivo Y91
description: The vivo Y91specifications include a 6.2-inch display with 720 x 1520 pixels resolution, MediaTek Helio P22 processor with 2 GB RAM, 13-megapixel camera and 4030 mAh battery.

description: The vivo Y93 specifications include a 6.22" IPS display with 720 x 1520 pixels resolution and 270 ppi. It also has a 13 MP camera. The unit is powered by a MediaTek Helio P22 processor, 4 GB of RAM and 4030 mAh battery.

name: Vivo V9 Pro
description: The vivo V9 Pro specifications include a 6.3" IPS display with 1080 x 2280 pixels resolution and 400 ppi. It also has a 13 MP camera. The unit is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 660 processor, 6 GB of RAM and 3260 mAh battery.

name: Vivo V11 Pro
description: The vivo V11 Pro specifications include a 6.41" Super AMOLED display with 1080 x 2340 pixels resolution, 402 ppi and in-display fingerprint scanner. It also has a 12 MP camera. The unit is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 660 processor, 6 GB of RAM and 3400 mAh battery.

name: Vivo Y83 Pro
description: The vivo Y83 Pro specifications include a 6.2-inch display with 720 x 1520 pixels resolution, MediaTek Helio P22 processor with 4 GB RAM, 13-megapixel camera and 3260 mAh battery.

name: Vivo NEX
description: The Vivo NEX has no display notch and merely a thin chin, as well as quite thin bezels on the sides. Dubbed Ultra FullView, the display is a 6.59-inch FHD+ Super AMOLED unit. The front-facing camera is placed onto an elevating mechanism that pops up when needed. Additionally, the Vivo NEX uses an in-display fingerprint scanner. As far as performance goes, the phone is boasting a Snapdragon 845, 8GB of RAM, 128GB of native storage, and a hefty 4,000mAh battery. Photography has not been overlooked - a 12MP f/1.8 main and 5MP f/2.4 depth-sensing cameras could be found at the rear. Android 8.1 running beneath Vivo's own Funtouch OS 4.0.

name: Vivo X21
description: The vivo X21 specifications include a 6.28" IPS display with 1080 x 2280 pixels resolution and 402 ppi with in-screen fingerprint reader. It also has a 12 MP camera. The unit is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 660 procesor, 6 GB of RAM and 3200 mAh battery.

name: Vivo X5Pro
os:
Android 5.0 Lollipop
Vivo Funtouch OS UI
description: The vivo X5Pro is a powerful smartphone with Android 5.0. Its specs include 5.2" 1080p display, 1.5 GHz octa-core CPU, 2 GB RAM, 16 GB ROM, microSD card slot for up to 128 GB extra storage, 13 MP rear camera with Sapphire crystal lens cover, and a 8 MP front one for video calls. Dual SIM card support is also present.

name: Vivo X5 Max
description: Chinese manufacturer Vivo officially announced the Vivo X5 Max, an uber-thin smartphone that measures just 0.15in (3.98mm) at its thinnest point and 0.18in (4.75mm) at its chubbiest. In terms of specs the phone offers a 5.5-inch 1080p Super-AMOLED screen and runs on a Qualcomm Snapdragon 615 1.7GHz octa-core processor, paired with 2GB of RAM and 16GB of expandable storage. A 13MP rear camera and a 5MP front cam take care of photos, while an Yamaha YSS-205X chip handles sound. The Vivo X5 Max runs Android 4.4.4 KitKat topped off with Funtouch OS 2.0.

name: Vivo Xplay 3S
description: The Vivo XPlay 3S is the world’s first smartphone with a 2560 x 1440 pixel 6 inch screen. It is powered by a 2.3GHz Snapdragon 800 processor and has 3GB of RAM and 32 GS storage space. Other features include a 13-megapixel camera with an f/1.8 aperture, and 4G LTE connectivity.

name: Motorola Moto G Play (2023)
description: The Motorola Moto G Play (2023) comes with 6.5-inch display with 90Hz refresh rate and MediaTek Helio G37 processor. Specs also include 5000mAh battery with 10W charging speed and Triple camera setup on the back with 16MP main sensor.

name: Motorola Moto G72
description: The Motorola Moto G72 comes with 6.55-inch P-OLED display with 120Hz refresh rate and MediaTek Helio G99 processor. Specs also include 5000mAh battery with 33W charging speed, Triple camera setup on the back with 108MP main sensor and 16MP front selfie camera.

name: Motorola Edge 30 Fusion
description: The Motorola Edge 30 Fusion comes with 6.55-inch P-OLED display with 144Hz refresh rate and Qualcomm Snapdragon 888+ processor. Specs also include 4400mAh battery with 68Wcharging speed, Triple camera setup in the back with 50 MP main sensor and 32MP front selfie camera.

name: Motorola Edge 30 Neo
description: The Motorola Edge 30 Neo comes with 6.28-inch display with 120Hz refresh rate and Qualcomm Snapdragon 695 processor. Specs also include 4020mAh battery with 68W charging speed, Dual camera setup on the back with 64MP main sensor and 32MP front selfie camera.

name: Motorola Edge 30 Ultra
description: The Motorola Edge 30 Ultra comes with 6.67-inch OLED display with 144Hz refresh rate and Qualcomm Snapdragon 8+ Gen 1 processor. Specs also include 5000mAh battery with 125W charging speed, Triple camera setup on the back with massive 200MP sensor and 60MP front selfie camera.

name: Motorola Edge (2022)
description: The Motorola Edge (2022) features a 6.6-inch AMOLED screen with a 144Hz refresh rate and a MediaTek Dimensity 1050 processor. A beefy 5,000mAh battery with 30W charging speed keeps the lights on. The phone features a triple camera system with a 50MP main sensor. The front camera is a 32MP shooter.

name: Motorola razr (2022)
description: Motorola did a very good job with the Razr 2022, crafting the fastest phone with foldable display at the time of launch and equipping it with the best camera set on such a handset, all at a great price. The 50MP rear camera is the first of its kind on a modern clamshell.

description: The Motorola Moto G51 5G comes with 6.8-inch display with 120Hz refresh rate and Qualcomm Snapdragon 480 processor. Specs also include 5000mAh battery with 10W charging speed, Triple camera setup on the back with 50MP main sensor and 13MP selfie shooter.

name: Motorola Moto G Power (2022)
description: The Motorola Moto G Power (2022) comes with 6.5-inch display with 90Hz refresh rate and MediaTek Helio G37 processor. Specs also include 5000mAh battery with 10W charging speed, Triple camera setup on the back with 50MP main sensor and 8MP front selfie camera.

name: Motorola Moto G Pure
description: The Motorola Moto G Pure comes with 6.5-inch HD+ display and it is powered by MediaTek Helio G25 processor. Specifications also include 4000mAh battery with 10W charging speed, Dual camera setup on the back with 13MP main sensor and 5MP selfie camera on the front.

name: Motorola Moto E20
description: The Motorola Moto E20 is a budget phone that comes with 6.5-inch HD+ display and Unisoc processor under the hood. Specifications also include 4000mAh battery with 10W charging speed, Dual camera setup on the back with 13MP main sensor and 5MP selfie camera on the front. The Moto E20 is powered by Android 11 GO and the prices is €100.

description: The Motorola Edge (2021) comes with 6.8-inch display with 144Hz refresh rate and Qualcomm Snapdragon 778G processor. Specifications also include 5000mAh battery with 30W Fast charging, Android 11 out of the box and Triple camera setup on the back with 108MP main sensor combined with 32MP front camera.

description: The Motorola Moto G60S comes with 6.8-inch display with 120Hz refresh rate and MediaTek Helio G95 processor.
